mark_primary.instruction: First, let's identify the fields for transcription. For each of the following, draw a box on the image.

options.label: Record Date
options.help: The record date can generally be found in the upper left hand corner of the record. If multiple dates appear, draw a box around each. This date can also appear on records as the "Date of Approval" and "Dated".

options.label: Record Number
options.help: The record number can generally be found in the upper right hand corner of the record.

options.label: Mortgager Name
options.help: The mortgager name is often found at the top of the list of hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records. The mortgager tends to be a single personâ€™s name. If multiple names are provided, draw one box around all of them. This field appears on records as "mortgager" and "applicant".

options.label: Street Address
options.help: The street address is often found at the top of the list of hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records. This field can appear as "No. of Street or Avenue", "House Number", "Premises", and "Location".

options.label: Amount Loaned
options.help: The amount loaned is typically found at or near the bottom of the record. It can appear on the record as "Amount Loaned", "Approved by the Finance Committee for $_____", or "Approved by the Executive Committee for $_____".

options.label: Number of Stories
options.help: Some records contain a field for a hand-written annotation of the number of stories in a building.

options.label: Building Material
options.help: Some records contain a field for a hand-written annotation of the building material.

type.label: Dimensions
type.help: Some records include the ground dimensions of the building. These are often found below the street address in the hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records. Otherwise, they may be written in the drawing of the building footprint in the top half of the records.

type.label: Building Description
type.help: The buiding description is often found in the middle of the list of hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records.
